item.title: Report E-2025020267
item.description:
Report E-2025020267

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-25T00:50:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-24
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-BAT contacted ERTS regarding a punctured lead acid battery. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 150-gallon of battery acid released onto the wooden trailer floor in a 40’x8.5’ area, The concrete dock floor in a 6’x10’ area, and the concrete beneath the trailer in a 60’x 20’ area resulting from a forklift puncture. The contractor neutralized the release using citric acid and applied oil dry. Four 55-gallon DF’s of waste were generated containing the neutralized impacted oil dry. PPE, poly sheeting, absorbent pads and pallet pieces. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report E-2025020252
item.description:
Report E-2025020252

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-23T00:59:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-21
  • City: CONYERS
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG Energy, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5010
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The driver had completed his delivery and was in the process of draining residual product from the delivery hose. It appears that there was an issue with the priming function on the valve which did not allow all of the product get removed from the delivery hose. When the driver disconnected the hose, approximately 5 gallons of product was released. ERC Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5675
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver overfilled the customer's storage tank. This resulted in approximately 40 gallons of diesel fuel being released. ERC Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.
